docs.snippet: More than half the money donated to groups campaigning in Britain's EU membership referendum was given by 10 individuals or companies, according to research published on Friday, raising questions over the outsize influence of the wealthy on politi...
docs.lead_paragraph: More than half the money donated to groups campaigning in Britain's EU membership referendum was given by 10 individuals or companies, according to research published on Friday, raising questions over the outsize influence of the wealthy on politics.

headline.main: Handful of Wealthy Donors Dominated Brexit Campaign Funding: Report
headline.print_headline: Handful of Wealthy Donors Dominated Brexit Campaign Funding: Report

docs.snippet: Prime Minister Theresa May will promise to make Britain "a sovereign and independent country" by repealing the act that took it into what is now the European Union next year, she told the Sunday Times newspaper....
docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Theresa May will promise to make Britain "a sovereign and independent country" by repealing the act that took it into what is now the European Union next year, she told the Sunday Times newspaper.

headline.print_headline: PM Vows to Make Britain 'Sovereign' in First Brexit Detail

docs.snippet: The Bank of England may need to revise up its growth forecasts after double-counting some of the costs of economic uncertainty linked to the country's Brexit vote, policymaker Kristin Forbes said in an interview published on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bank of England may need to revise up its growth forecasts after double-counting some of the costs of economic uncertainty linked to the country's Brexit vote, policymaker Kristin Forbes said in an interview published on Thursday.

headline.main: Bank of England May Have Double-Counted Brexit Costs-Forbes
headline.print_headline: Bank of England May Have Double-Counted Brexit Costs-Forbes

docs.snippet: The University of Oxford, the oldest university in the English-speaking world and feeder for the British elite, has topped a global education ranking for the first time, but its vice-chancellor warned that Brexit could damage its long-term prospec...
docs.lead_paragraph: The University of Oxford, the oldest university in the English-speaking world and feeder for the British elite, has topped a global education ranking for the first time, but its vice-chancellor warned that Brexit could damage its long-term prospects.

headline.main: Oxford Ranked World's Top University, Just as Brexit Looms

docs.snippet: Switzerland's central bank made more foreign currency purchases in the second quarter than at any time since it stunned financial markets more than a year ago by ending a cap on the Swiss franc, data showed on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Switzerland's central bank made more foreign currency purchases in the second quarter than at any time since it stunned financial markets more than a year ago by ending a cap on the Swiss franc, data showed on Wednesday.

headline.main: Brexit Pushes SNB to Highest Forex Purchases Since Scrapping Cap
headline.print_headline: Brexit Pushes SNB to Highest Forex Purchases Since Scrapping Cap

docs.snippet: Online trading company IG Group Holdings Plc said on Tuesday financial markets had become "increasingly subdued" in the two months after Britain's shock vote to leave the European Union, presenting clients with limited trading opportunities....
docs.lead_paragraph: Online trading company IG Group Holdings Plc said on Tuesday financial markets had become "increasingly subdued" in the two months after Britain's shock vote to leave the European Union, presenting clients with limited trading opportunities.

headline.main: IG Reports 'Increasingly Subdued' Markets After Brexit Vote
headline.print_headline: IG Reports 'Increasingly Subdued' Markets After Brexit Vote

docs.snippet: Banks in Britain are the largest borrowers and lenders of euros outside the single currency area, BIS figures showed on Sunday, underscoring what's at stake for Britain if its lenders fail to maintain access to EU markets after the country leaves ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Banks in Britain are the largest borrowers and lenders of euros outside the single currency area, BIS figures showed on Sunday, underscoring what's at stake for Britain if its lenders fail to maintain access to EU markets after the country leaves the bloc.

headline.main: London's Core Role in Euros Under Spotlight After Brexit Vote
headline.print_headline: London's Core Role in Euros Under Spotlight After Brexit Vote

docs.lead_paragraph: EU chief executive Jean-Claude Juncker warned divided Europeans on Wednesday that their Union was in an "existential crisis" after Britain's vote to quit and said leaders must pull together to stop it unraveling.

headline.print_headline: Europe Divided, Juncker Urges Post-Brexit EU to Unite

headline.main: UK's Biggest Housebuilder Barratt Shrugs Off Brexit With Sales Rise

docs.snippet: British Prime Minister Theresa May said Sunday that she intends to seize new trading opportunities for a Britain that has voted to leave the European Union, reiterating that "Brexit does indeed mean Brexit" and there will be "no attempt to get out...
docs.lead_paragraph: British Prime Minister Theresa May said Sunday that she intends to seize new trading opportunities for a Britain that has voted to leave the European Union, reiterating that "Brexit does indeed mean Brexit" and there will be "no attempt to get out of this."

headline.main: Britain's May Seeks Out New Trading Relations Post-Brexit
headline.print_headline: Britain's May Seeks Out New Trading Relations Post-Brexit
